==Events==
* [[480]] &ndash; [[Odoacer]], first [[King of Italy]], occupies [[Dalmatia]]. He later establishes his political power with the co-operation of the [[Roman Senate]].
* [[536]] &ndash; [[Gothic War (535–554)|Gothic War]]: The Byzantine general [[Belisarius]] enters Rome unopposed; the [[Goths|Gothic]] garrison flee the capital.
* [[730]] &ndash; [[Battle of Marj Ardabil]]: The [[Khazar]]s annihilate an [[Umayyad]] army and kill its commander, [[al-Jarrah ibn Abdallah al-Hakami]].
*[[1425]] &ndash; The [[Old University of Leuven|Catholic University of Leuven]] is founded.
*[[1531]] &ndash; [[Our Lady of Guadalupe|The Virgin of Guadalupe]] first appears to [[Juan Diego]] at [[Tepeyac]], Mexico City.
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: British troops lose the [[Battle of Great Bridge]], and leave [[Virginia]] soon afterward.
*[[1793]] &ndash; New York City's first daily [[newspaper]], the ''American Minerva'', is established by [[Noah Webster]].
*[[1824]] &ndash; Patriot forces led by General [[Antonio José de Sucre]] defeat a Royalist army in the [[Battle of Ayacucho]], putting an end to the [[Peruvian War of Independence]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; [[Texas Revolution]]: The [[Texian Army]] captures [[San Antonio, Texas]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; The first [[YMCA]] in North America is established in [[Montreal]].
*[[1856]] &ndash; The [[Iran]]ian city of [[Bushehr]] surrenders to occupying British forces.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Joint Committee on the Conduct of the War]] is established by the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; In [[Louisiana]], [[P. B. S. Pinchback]] becomes the first serving [[African-American]] governor of a U.S. state.
*[[1875]] &ndash; The [[Massachusetts Rifle Association]], "America's Oldest Active Gun Club", is founded.
*[[1888]] &ndash; Statistician [[Herman Hollerith]] installs his computing device at the [[United States War Department]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; Activist [[Marguerite Durand]] founds the [[feminist]] daily newspaper ''[[La Fronde (newspaper)|La Fronde]]'' in Paris.
*[[1905]] &ndash; In France, the [[1905 French law on the Separation of the Churches and the State|law separating church and state]] is passed.
*[[1911]] &ndash; A [[Cross Mountain Mine disaster|mine explosion]] near [[Briceville, Tennessee]], kills 84 miners despite rescue efforts led by the [[United States Bureau of Mines]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: In [[Palestine]], Field Marshal [[Edmund Allenby, 1st Viscount Allenby|Edmund Allenby]] [[Battle of Jerusalem (1917)|captures Jerusalem]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Gabriel Narutowicz]] is elected the first president of Poland.
*[[1931]] &ndash; The [[Constituent Cortes]] approves a [[Spanish Constitution of 1931|constitution]] which establishes the [[Second Spanish Republic]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Walter Liggett]], American newspaper editor and muckraker, is killed in a gangland murder.
*  1935   &ndash; The [[Downtown Athletic Club|Downtown Athletic Club Trophy]], later renamed the [[Heisman Trophy]], is awarded for the first time.  The winner is halfback [[Jay Berwanger]] of the [[University of Chicago]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: [[Battle of Nanking]] &ndash; [[Imperial Japan|Japanese]] troops under the command of Lt. Gen. [[Asaka Yasuhiko]] launch an assault on the [[Republic of China|Chinese]] city of [[Nanjing]] (Nanking).
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Operation Compass]] &ndash; British and Indian troops under the command of Major-General [[Richard O'Connor]] attack [[Military history of Italy during World War II|Italian]] forces near [[Sidi Barrani]] in [[Egypt]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Republic of China]], [[Cuba]], [[Guatemala]], and [[Commonwealth of the Philippines|the Philippine Commonwealth]], declare war on [[Nazi Germany|Germany]] and [[Imperial Japan|Japan]].
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: The American [[19th Operations Group|19th Bombardment Group]] attacks Japanese ships off the coast of [[Vigan]], [[Luzon]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The "[[Subsequent Nuremberg trials]]" begin with the "[[Doctors' trial]]", prosecuting physicians and officers alleged to be involved in [[Nazi human experimentation]] and [[Action T4|mass murder under the guise of euthanasia]].
*  1946   &ndash; The [[Constituent Assembly of India]] meets for the first time to write the [[Constitution of India]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[Harry Gold]] is sentenced to 30 years in jail for helping [[Klaus Fuchs]] pass information about the [[Manhattan Project]] to the [[Soviet Union]]. His testimony is later instrumental in the prosecution of [[Julius and Ethel Rosenberg]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Second Red Scare|Red Scare]]: [[General Electric]] announces that all [[communist]] employees will be discharged from the company.
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Trans-Canada Air Lines Flight 810]], a [[Canadair North Star]], crashes near [[Hope, British Columbia]], Canada, killing all 62 people on board.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[John Birch Society]] is founded in the United States.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The first episode of ''[[Coronation Street]]'', the world's longest-running television [[soap opera]], is broadcast in the United Kingdom.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Tanganyika]] becomes independent from Britain.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Petrified Forest National Park]] is established in [[Arizona]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Kecksburg UFO incident]]: A fireball is seen from Michigan to Pennsylvania; witnesses report something crashing in the woods near Pittsburgh. In 2005 NASA admits that [[Kecksburg UFO incident#2005: NASA changes story to "Russian satellite"|it examined the object]].
* 1965  &ndash; [[A Charlie Brown Christmas]], first in a series of [[Peanuts]] television specials, debuts on [[CBS]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Barbados]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Douglas Engelbart]] gave what became known as "[[The Mother of All Demos]]", publicly debuting the [[Mouse (computer)|computer mouse]], [[hypertext]], and the bit-mapped [[graphical user interface]] using the [[NLS (computer system)|oN-Line System (NLS)]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; U.S. Secretary of State [[William P. Rogers]] proposes [[Rogers Plan|his plan]] for a ceasefire in the [[War of Attrition]]; Egypt and Jordan accept it over the objections of the [[Palestinian Liberation Organization|PLO]], which leads to [[Black September in Jordan|civil war in Jordan]] in September 1970.
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[United Arab Emirates]] join the [[United Nations]].
*  1971   &ndash; [[Indo-Pakistani War of 1971|Indo-Pakistani War]]: The [[Indian Air Force]] executes [[Meghna Heli Bridge|an airdrop]] of [[Indian Army]] units, bypassing Pakistani defences.
*[[1973]] &ndash; British and Irish authorities sign the [[Sunningdale Agreement]] in an attempt to establish a power-sharing [[Northern Ireland Executive (1974)|Northern Ireland Executive]] and a cross-border [[Council of Ireland]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; The eradication of the [[smallpox]] [[virus]] is certified, making smallpox the first and to date only human disease driven to extinction.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]]: The [[First Intifada]] begins in the [[Gaza Strip]] and [[West Bank]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Michael Hughes Bridge]] in [[Sligo]], Ireland, is officially opened.
*[[2003]] &ndash; A [[Red Square Bombing|blast]] in the center of Moscow kills six people and wounds several more.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[Governor of Illinois]], [[Rod Blagojevich]], is arrested by federal officials for crimes including attempting to sell the [[United States Senate|U.S. Senate]] seat being vacated by [[President-elect of the United States|President-elect]] [[Barack Obama|Barack Obama's]] election to the Presidency.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least seven are dead and 63 are injured following a [[2013 Bintaro train crash|train accident]] near Bintaro, [[Indonesia]].

==Holidays and observances==
*Anna's Day, marks the day to start the preparation process of the [[lutefisk]] to be consumed on [[Christmas Eve]], as well as a [[Name days in Sweden|Swedish name day]], celebrating all people named Anna. (Sweden and Finland)
*Christian [[Feast Day]]:
**[[Feast of the Immaculate Conception#Eastern Orthodoxy|Feast of the Conception of the Most Holy Theotokos by St. Anne]] ([[Orthodox Church]])
**[[Juan Diego]]
**[[Leocadia]]
**[[Nectarius of Auvergne]]
**[[Peter Fourier]]
**[[December 9 (Eastern Orthodox liturgics)]]
*[[Independence Day]], celebrate the independence of [[Tanganyika]] from [[United Kingdom|Britain]] in 1961. ([[Tanzania]])
*[[International Anti-Corruption Day]] ([[International observance|International]])
*[[Public holidays in Antigua and Barbuda|National Heroes Day]], formerly V.C. Bird Day. ([[Antigua and Barbuda]])
*[[Yuri's Day|Yuri's Day in the Autumn]] ([[Russian Orthodox Church]])
